meta.content: Front Page; New York and Region
meta.name: online_sections

block.p: Another New Design Santiago Calatrava, who designed the World Trade Center transportation hub, is planning a residential tower in Lower Manhattan.
Estrogen Study Halted A large study of estrogen therapy in postmenopausal women was stopped because estrogen increased the risk of stroke.
Another New Design Santiago Calatrava, who designed the World Trade Center transportation hub, is planning a residential tower in Lower Manhattan.
Estrogen Study Halted A large study of estrogen therapy in postmenopausal women was stopped because estrogen increased the risk of stroke.
Haiti Confusion Deepens A rebel leader in Haiti proclaimed himself chief of a revived army and threatened to jail the prime minister.

Correction: March 10, 2004, Wednesday An architectural rendering on March 3 with an article about a design by Santiago Calatrava for an apartment tower in Lower Manhattan, and another version with a front-page contents entry, carried an incomplete credit. (The error occurred again in some editions yesterday.) While Mr. Calatrava's studio created the image of the building, the background photograph was by David Sundberg/Esto.

An architectural rendering on March 3 with an article about a design by Santiago Calatrava for an apartment tower in Lower Manhattan, and another version with a front-page contents entry, carried an incomplete credit. (The error occurred again in some editions yesterday.) While Mr. Calatrava's studio created the image of the building, the background photograph was by David Sundberg/Esto.
